definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now

sentences.english: He was a good all-rounder of the music.
Even until now nobody can be compared to this all-rounder in basketball.
sentences.chinese: 即使到現在任何人都不能與此相比，全才的籃球。

sentences.english: All-rounder can't take place of perseverance. It's ubiquitousness that an all-rounder can't achieve succeed.
sentences.chinese: 全才不能取代堅持，是全才而沒有成功的人比比皆是。

sentences.english: All-rounder can't take place of perseverance. It's ubiquitousness that an all-rounder can't achieve succeed.
sentences.chinese: 全才不能取代堅持，是全才而沒有成功的人比比皆是。

sentences.english: He is very good at mountain-and-water, flower-and-bird, character, and Chinese calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 又以花鳥最爲精妙，是位非常罕見的全才畫家。

sentences.english: Remember to educate the whole child—for heart as well as mind.
sentences.chinese: 記住教育一個全才的孩子，不僅要用心還要用腦。

sentences.english: He outstanding music versatile person, in write words, compose music, scene made.
sentences.chinese: 他是出色的音樂全才，在作詞，作曲，場景製作。

definition: well versed in letters and military technology (idiom); fine scholar and soldier/master of pen and sword
to be proficient in/to master (a subject)
conversant with things past and present/erudite and informed
erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able
switch to a job one was not trained for
the present age/in office/the current office holder
